page.title: 01National Nature Reserve
page.content: This 4x3 km block has roughly 1 sq km of land at Dowlands, Charton Bay and Humble Point and was the site of the Great Landslip of 1839 at Dowlands. This strip of coast forms part of the Seaton-Lyme Regis coast walk, a 6 mile path between the pebble bar at Axmouth and Devonshire Head at Lyme Regis. This path, a National Nature Reserve under the protection of the Nature Conservancy Council (NCC), follows some of the wildest terrain in southern England and the visitor on this four hour walk will be rewarded with views over the sea as well as a wide variety of woodlands, plants, animals and birds. On our walk exploring this path we met Norman Barns of the NCC who is the author of an informative pamphlet about the reserve and responsible for its well-being.
